Dating: 25TH DYNASTY AND CONTEMPORARIES (not before); 26TH DYNASTY (not after)
Name: Inner coffin of Pe-de-ese
Description: The matching outer coffin and the mummy of Pe-de-ese are also preserved. The inner coffin is richly decorated with representations of the adoration of the Abydos fetish, Osiris and Re-Harakhty, the mummy on a bier, Osiris in a tree. On the outer coffin are the four sons of Horus, Thoth accompanying the deceased to Osiris and Isis and Nephthys.The cartonnage cover (ÄOS 3940b) and mummy (ÄOS 8903) of Pe-de-ese are also part of the collections of the Vienna Museum.
